trans-unit.source: Provides a mechanism for executing a method on a thread pool thread at specified intervals.
This class cannot be inherited.
Use a <xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback> delegate to specify the method you want the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> to execute.
trans-unit.target: 使用<xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback>委托来指定所需的方法<xref:System.Threading.Timer>执行。

trans-unit.source: The signature of the <xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback> delegate is:
trans-unit.target: 签名<xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback>委托是：

trans-unit.source: The timer delegate is specified when the timer is constructed, and cannot be changed.
trans-unit.target: 计时器构造的并且不能更改时，指定计时器委托。

trans-unit.source: The method does not execute on the thread that created the timer; it executes on a <xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool> thread supplied by the system.
trans-unit.target: 创建计时器; 的线程上不执行该方法它执行上<xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool>系统所提供的线程。

trans-unit.source: .NET includes four classes named `Timer`, each of which offers different functionality:
trans-unit.target: .NET 包括名为的四个类`Timer`，每个的它提供不同的功能：

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Timers.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType>, which fires an event and executes the code in one or more event sinks at regular intervals.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Timers.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType>其中激发事件并在一个执行的代码或多个事件接收器按固定的间隔。

trans-unit.source: The class is intended for use as a server-based or service component in a multithreaded environment; it has no user interface and is not visible at runtime.
trans-unit.target: 类旨在用作基于服务器或多线程环境中; 中的服务组件它没有用户界面，并且不在运行时可见。

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType>, which executes a single callback method on a thread pool thread at regular intervals.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType>其中固定时间间隔线程池线程上执行单个回调方法。

trans-unit.source: The callback method is defined when the timer is instantiated and cannot be changed.
trans-unit.target: 当计时器实例化，并且不能更改定义回调方法。

trans-unit.source: Like the <xref:System.Timers.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> class, this class is intended for use as a server-based or service component in a multithreaded environment; it has no user interface and is not visible at runtime.
trans-unit.target: 如<xref:System.Timers.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType>类，该类适用于使用作为多线程环境中的基于服务器的或服务组件; 它没有用户界面，并且不在运行时可见。

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> (.NET Framework only), a Windows Forms component that fires an event and executes the code in one or more event sinks at regular intervals.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> (仅在.NET framework 中)，激发事件并在固定时间间隔的一个或多个事件接收器中执行的代码的 Windows 窗体组件。

trans-unit.source: The component has no user interface and is designed for use in a single-threaded environment; it executes on the UI thread.
trans-unit.target: 该组件没有用户界面，专用于在单线程环境中;它在 UI 线程上执行。

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Web.UI.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> (.NET Framework only), an ASP.NET component that performs asynchronous or synchronous web page postbacks at a regular interval.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Web.UI.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> (仅在.NET framework 中)，在按固定间隔执行异步或同步网页回发的 ASP.NET 组件。

trans-unit.source: When you create a timer, you can specify an amount of time to wait before the first execution of the method (due time), and an amount of time to wait between subsequent executions (period).
trans-unit.target: 当创建计时器时，可以指定的方法在首次执行之前要等待的时间量 （到期时间），以及数量的后续执行 （句点） 之间的等待时间。

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.Timer> class has the same resolution as the system clock.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.Timer>类具有相同的系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: This means that if the period is less than the resolution of the system clock, the <xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback> delegate will execute at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems.
trans-unit.target: 这意味着，如果期间为早于系统时钟的分辨率<xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback>委托将在大约 15 毫秒在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系统的系统时钟的分辨率所定义的时间间隔执行。

trans-unit.source: You can change the due time and period, or disable the timer, by using the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 你可以更改到期时间和时间或禁用计时器，通过使用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: As long as you are using a <xref:System.Threading.Timer>, you must keep a reference to it.
trans-unit.target: 只要你使用<xref:System.Threading.Timer>，你必须保留对它的引用。

trans-unit.source: As with any managed object, a <xref:System.Threading.Timer> is subject to garbage collection when there are no references to it.
trans-unit.target: 与任何托管对象，<xref:System.Threading.Timer>没有引用时才进行垃圾回收。

trans-unit.source: The fact that a <xref:System.Threading.Timer> is still active does not prevent it from being collected.
trans-unit.target: 这一事实，<xref:System.Threading.Timer>是仍处于活动状态不会阻止它正在收集。

trans-unit.source: When a timer is no longer needed, use the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%2A> method to free the resources held by the timer.
trans-unit.target: 当不再需要计时器时，使用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%2A>计时器持有方法来释放资源。

trans-unit.source: Note that callbacks can occur after the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose> method overload has been called, because the timer queues callbacks for execution by thread pool threads.
trans-unit.target: 请注意，回调可能发生后<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose>已调用方法重载，因为计时器是按线程池线程来安排回调的执行。

trans-unit.source: You can use the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29> method overload to wait until all callbacks have completed.
trans-unit.target: 你可以使用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29>方法重载来等待，直到完成所有的回调。

trans-unit.source: The callback method executed by the timer should be reentrant, because it is called on <xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool> threads.
trans-unit.target: 执行由计时器回调方法应该可重入，因为它调用<xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool>线程。

trans-unit.source: The callback can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the callback, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the callback is queued multiple times.
trans-unit.target: 回调可同时执行两个线程池线程上如果计时器间隔小于执行回调，所需的时间，或者如果正在使用的所有线程池线程和回调排队多次。

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> is a simple, lightweight timer that uses callback methods and is served by thread pool threads.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> 是一个简单的轻型计时器，它使用回调方法，并由线程池线程。

trans-unit.source: It is not recommended for use with Windows Forms, because its callbacks do not occur on the user interface thread.
trans-unit.target: 不建议用于 Windows 窗体，因为其回调不会在用户界面线程上发生。

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> is a better choice for use with Windows Forms.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType> 是更好的选择为使用 Windows 窗体。

trans-unit.source: For server-based timer functionality, you might consider using <xref:System.Timers.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType>, which raises events and has additional features.
trans-unit.target: 对于基于服务器的计时器功能，你可以考虑使用<xref:System.Timers.Timer?displayProperty=nameWithType>，这可引发事件并具有附加功能。

trans-unit.source: The following example defines a `StatusChecker` class that includes a `CheckStatus` method whose signature is the same as the <xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback> delegate.
trans-unit.target: 下面的示例定义`StatusChecker`类，包含`CheckStatus`方法，其签名为相同作为<xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback>委托。

trans-unit.source: The `state` argument of the `CheckStatus` method is an <xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent> object that is used to synchronize the application thread and the thread pool thread that executes the callback delegate.
trans-unit.target: `state`参数`CheckStatus`方法是<xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent>用于同步的应用程序线程和线程池线程执行的回调委托的对象。

trans-unit.source: The `StatusChecker` class also includes two state variables:
trans-unit.target: `StatusChecker`类还进行了两个状态变量：

trans-unit.source: Indicates the number of times the callback method has been invoked.
trans-unit.target: 指示在调用回调方法的次数。

trans-unit.source: Determines the maximum number of times the callback method should be invoked.
trans-unit.target: 确定应调用回调方法最大次数。

trans-unit.source: The application thread creates the timer, which waits one second and then executes the `CheckStatus` callback method every 250 milliseconds.
trans-unit.target: 应用程序线程创建计时器，该等待 1 秒，然后执行`CheckStatus`回调方法每隔 250 毫秒。

trans-unit.source: The application thread then blocks until the <xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent> object is signaled.
trans-unit.target: 然后阻止的应用程序线程，直至<xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent>对象处于有信号状态。

trans-unit.source: When the `CheckStatus` callback method executes `maxCount` times, it calls the `AutoResetEvent.Set` method to set the state of the <xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent> object to signaled.
trans-unit.target: 当`CheckStatus`执行回调方法`maxCount`时间，它调用`AutoResetEvent.Set`方法以设置的状态<xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent>对象为终止状态。

trans-unit.source: The first time this happens, the application thread calls the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method so that the callback method now executes every half second.
trans-unit.target: 第一次发生这种情况，应用程序线程调用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29>方法，以便回调方法现在执行每半秒。

trans-unit.source: It once again blocks until the <xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent> object is signaled.
trans-unit.target: 它再次阻止，直至<xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent>对象处于有信号状态。

trans-unit.source: When this happens, the timer is destroyed by calling its <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%2A> method, and the application terminates.
trans-unit.target: 当发生这种情况时，计时器被销毁通过调用其<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%2A>方法，且应用程序终止。

trans-unit.source: This type is thread safe.
trans-unit.target: 此类型是线程安全的。

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the <see langword="Timer" /> class.
A <see cref="T:System.Threading.TimerCallback" /> delegate representing a method to be executed.

Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> class with an infinite period and an infinite due time, using the newly created <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> object as the state object.
Call this constructor when you want to use the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> object itself as the state object.
trans-unit.target: 调用此构造函数，当你想要使用<xref:System.Threading.Timer>对象作为的状态对象。

trans-unit.source: After creating the timer, use the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method to set the interval and due time.
trans-unit.target: 创建计时器后，使用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法以设置间隔和到期时间。

trans-unit.source: This constructor specifies an infinite due time before the first callback and an infinite interval between callbacks, in order to prevent the first callback from occurring before the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> object is assigned to the state object.
trans-unit.target: 此构造函数指定一个无限到期时间之前第一次回调和两个回调，以防之前发生第一次回调之间无限间隔<xref:System.Threading.Timer>对象分配给的状态对象。

trans-unit.source: The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on <xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool> threads.
trans-unit.target: 指定的方法`callback`应该是可重入，因为它调用<xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool>线程。

trans-unit.source: The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times.
trans-unit.target: 该方法可同时执行两个线程池线程上的计时器间隔是否早于执行该方法所需的时间或是否所有线程池线程都正在使用，并且该方法进行排队多次。

trans-unit.source: The following code example creates a new timer, using the timer itself as the state object.
trans-unit.target: 下面的代码示例创建一个新的计时器，该计时器本身用作的状态对象。

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method is used to start the timer.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法用于启动计时器。

trans-unit.source: When the timer callback occurs, the state object is used to turn the timer off.
trans-unit.target: 计时器回调时，用于将计时器关闭的状态对象。

trans-unit.source: A <see cref="T:System.Threading.TimerCallback" /> delegate representing a method to be executed.
An object containing information to be used by the callback method, or <see langword="null" />.
The amount of time to delay before <c>callback</c> is invoked, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to prevent the timer from starting.
Specify zero (0) to start the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of <c>callback</c>, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to disable periodic signaling.
Initializes a new instance of the <see langword="Timer" /> class, using a 32-bit signed integer to specify the time interval.
The delegate specified by the `callback` parameter is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the `period` time interval elapses.
trans-unit.target: 所指定的委托`callback`参数调用一次后`dueTime`过后，以及之后每次`period`时间间隔结束。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is zero (0), `callback` is invoked immediately.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为零 (0)，`callback`则会立即调用。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, `callback` is not invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`是<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，`callback`不会被调用; 处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用重新启用它计时器<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: Because the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> class has the same resolution as the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems, the `callback` delegate executes at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock if `period` is less than the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 因为<xref:System.Threading.Timer>类具有相同的分辨率大约为 15 毫秒在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系统上，系统时钟`callback`委托执行间隔由定义系统时钟的分辨率如果`period`小于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: If `period` is zero (0) or <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType> and `dueTime` is not <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, `callback` is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled using the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果`period`为零 (0) 或<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>和`dueTime`不<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，`callback`调用计时器的定期行为处于禁用状态，但可以使用重新启用它一次;<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on <xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool> threads.
trans-unit.target: 指定的方法`callback`应该是可重入，因为它调用<xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool>线程。

trans-unit.source: The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times.
trans-unit.target: 该方法可同时执行两个线程池线程上的计时器间隔是否早于执行该方法所需的时间或是否所有线程池线程都正在使用，并且该方法进行排队多次。

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to create a `TimerCallback` delegate and initialize a new instance of the `Timer` class.
trans-unit.target: 下面的代码示例演示如何创建`TimerCallback`委托和初始化的新实例`Timer`类。

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter is negative and is not equal to <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" />.
The <paramref name="callback" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
A <see cref="T:System.Threading.TimerCallback" /> delegate representing a method to be executed.
An object containing information to be used by the callback method, or <see langword="null" />.
The amount of time to delay before <c>callback</c> is invoked, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to prevent the timer from starting.
Specify zero (0) to start the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of <c>callback</c>, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to disable periodic signaling.
Initializes a new instance of the <see langword="Timer" /> class, using 64-bit signed integers to measure time intervals.
The delegate specified by the `callback` parameter is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the `period` time interval elapses.
trans-unit.target: 所指定的委托`callback`参数调用一次后`dueTime`过后，以及之后每次`period`时间间隔结束。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is zero (0), `callback` is invoked immediately.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为零 (0)，`callback`则会立即调用。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, `callback` is not invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`是<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，`callback`不会被调用; 处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用重新启用它计时器<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: Because the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> class has the same resolution as the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems, the `callback` delegate executes at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock if `period` is less than the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 因为<xref:System.Threading.Timer>类具有相同的分辨率大约为 15 毫秒在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系统上，系统时钟`callback`委托执行间隔由定义系统时钟的分辨率如果`period`小于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: If `period` is zero (0) or <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType> and `dueTime` is not <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, `callback` is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled using the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果`period`为零 (0) 或<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>和`dueTime`不<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，`callback`调用计时器的定期行为处于禁用状态，但可以使用重新启用它一次;<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on <xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool> threads.
trans-unit.target: 指定的方法`callback`应该是可重入，因为它调用<xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool>线程。

trans-unit.source: The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times.
trans-unit.target: 该方法可同时执行两个线程池线程上的计时器间隔是否早于执行该方法所需的时间或是否所有线程池线程都正在使用，并且该方法进行排队多次。

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter is negative and is not equal to <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" />.
The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter is greater than 4294967294.
A delegate representing a method to be executed.
An object containing information to be used by the callback method, or <see langword="null" />.
The amount of time to delay before the <c>callback</c> parameter invokes its methods.
Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to prevent the timer from starting.
Specify zero (0) to start the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of the methods referenced by <c>callback</c>.
Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to disable periodic signaling.
Initializes a new instance of the <see langword="Timer" /> class, using <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> values to measure time intervals.
The delegate specified by the `callback` parameter is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the `period` time interval elapses.
trans-unit.target: 所指定的委托`callback`参数调用一次后`dueTime`过后，以及之后每次`period`时间间隔结束。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is zero (0), `callback` is invoked immediately.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为零 (0)，`callback`则会立即调用。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is negative one (-1) milliseconds, `callback` is not invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为负一 (-1) 毫秒，`callback`不会被调用; 处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用重新启用它计时器<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: Because the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> class has the same resolution as the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems, the `callback` delegate executes at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock if `period` is less than the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 因为<xref:System.Threading.Timer>类具有相同的分辨率大约为 15 毫秒在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系统上，系统时钟`callback`委托执行间隔由定义系统时钟的分辨率如果`period`小于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: If `period` is zero (0) or negative one (-1) milliseconds and `dueTime` is positive, `callback` is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled using the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果`period`是零 (0) 或负一 (-1) 毫秒和`dueTime`为正、`callback`调用计时器的定期行为处于禁用状态，但可以使用重新启用它一次;<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on <xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool> threads.
trans-unit.target: 指定的方法`callback`应该是可重入，因为它调用<xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool>线程。

trans-unit.source: The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times.
trans-unit.target: 该方法可同时执行两个线程池线程上的计时器间隔是否早于执行该方法所需的时间或是否所有线程池线程都正在使用，并且该方法进行排队多次。

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to create a `TimerCallback` delegate and initialize a new instance of the `Timer` class.
trans-unit.target: 下面的代码示例演示如何创建`TimerCallback`委托和初始化的新实例`Timer`类。

trans-unit.source: The number of milliseconds in the value of <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> is negative and not equal to <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" />, or is greater than <see cref="F:System.Int32.MaxValue" />.
The <paramref name="callback" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
A delegate representing a method to be executed.
An object containing information to be used by the callback method, or <see langword="null" />.
The amount of time to delay before <c>callback</c> is invoked, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to prevent the timer from starting.
Specify zero (0) to start the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of <c>callback</c>, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to disable periodic signaling.
Initializes a new instance of the <see langword="Timer" /> class, using 32-bit unsigned integers to measure time intervals.
The delegate specified by the `callback` parameter is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the `period` time interval elapses.
trans-unit.target: 所指定的委托`callback`参数调用一次后`dueTime`过后，以及之后每次`period`时间间隔结束。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is zero (0), `callback` is invoked immediately.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为零 (0)，`callback`则会立即调用。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, `callback` is not invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`是<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，`callback`不会被调用; 处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用重新启用它计时器<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: Because the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> class has the same resolution as the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems, the `callback` delegate executes at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock if `period` is less than the resolution of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: 因为<xref:System.Threading.Timer>类具有相同的分辨率大约为 15 毫秒在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系统上，系统时钟`callback`委托执行间隔由定义系统时钟的分辨率如果`period`小于系统时钟的分辨率。

trans-unit.source: If `period` is zero (0) or <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType> and `dueTime` is not <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, `callback` is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled using the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果`period`为零 (0) 或<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>和`dueTime`不<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，`callback`调用计时器的定期行为处于禁用状态，但可以使用重新启用它一次;<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on <xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool> threads.
trans-unit.target: 指定的方法`callback`应该是可重入，因为它调用<xref:System.Threading.ThreadPool>线程。

trans-unit.source: The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times.
trans-unit.target: 该方法可同时执行两个线程池线程上的计时器间隔是否早于执行该方法所需的时间或是否所有线程池线程都正在使用，并且该方法进行排队多次。

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter is negative and is not equal to <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" />.
The <paramref name="callback" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
Changes the start time and the interval between method invocations for a timer.
The amount of time to delay before the invoking the callback method specified when the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> was constructed, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to prevent the timer from restarting.
Specify zero (0) to restart the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of the callback method specified when the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> was constructed, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to disable periodic signaling.
Changes the start time and the interval between method invocations for a timer, using 32-bit signed integers to measure time intervals.
<see langword="true" /> if the timer was successfully updated; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
The callback method is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the time interval specified by `period` elapses.
trans-unit.target: 一次后调用的回调方法`dueTime`过后，并且之后每次指定的时间间隔内`period`间隔。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is zero (0), the callback method is invoked immediately.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为零 (0)，则会立即调用回调方法。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the callback method is never invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> and specifying a positive value for `dueTime`.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`是<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，永远不会调用回调方法，计时器处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用来重新启用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>并指定为正值`dueTime`。

trans-unit.source: If `period` is zero (0) or <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and `dueTime` is not <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the callback method is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> and specifying a positive value for `period`.
trans-unit.target: 如果`period`为零 (0) 或<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，和`dueTime`不<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，一次调用回调方法，计时器定期行为处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用来重新启用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>并指定为正值`period`.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method can be called from the <xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback> delegate.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法可以从调用<xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback>委托。

trans-unit.source: The following code example demonstrates how to start a `Timer` and, after a set number of invocations, change its period.
trans-unit.target: 下面的代码示例演示如何开始`Timer`以及在多次调用后更改其周期。

trans-unit.source: The <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> has already been disposed.
The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter is negative and is not equal to <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" />.
The amount of time to delay before the invoking the callback method specified when the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> was constructed, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to prevent the timer from restarting.
Specify zero (0) to restart the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of the callback method specified when the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> was constructed, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to disable periodic signaling.
Changes the start time and the interval between method invocations for a timer, using 64-bit signed integers to measure time intervals.
<see langword="true" /> if the timer was successfully updated; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
The callback method is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the time interval specified by `period` elapses.
trans-unit.target: 一次后调用的回调方法`dueTime`过后，并且之后每次指定的时间间隔内`period`间隔。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is zero (0), the callback method is invoked immediately.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为零 (0)，则会立即调用回调方法。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the callback method is never invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> and specifying a positive value for `dueTime`.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`是<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，永远不会调用回调方法，计时器处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用来重新启用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>并指定为正值`dueTime`。

trans-unit.source: If `period` is zero (0) or <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and `dueTime` is not <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the callback method is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> and specifying a positive value for `period`.
trans-unit.target: 如果`period`为零 (0) 或<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，和`dueTime`不<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，一次调用回调方法，计时器定期行为处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用来重新启用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>并指定为正值`period`.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method can be called from the <xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback> delegate.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法可以从调用<xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback>委托。

trans-unit.source: The <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> has already been disposed.
The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter is less than -1.
The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter is greater than 4294967294.
A <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> representing the amount of time to delay before invoking the callback method specified when the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> was constructed.
Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to prevent the timer from restarting.
Specify zero (0) to restart the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of the callback method specified when the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> was constructed.
Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to disable periodic signaling.
Changes the start time and the interval between method invocations for a timer, using <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> values to measure time intervals.
<see langword="true" /> if the timer was successfully updated; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
The callback method is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the time interval specified by `period` elapses.
trans-unit.target: 一次后调用的回调方法`dueTime`过后，并且之后每次指定的时间间隔内`period`间隔。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is zero (0), the callback method is invoked immediately.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为零 (0)，则会立即调用回调方法。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is negative one (-1) milliseconds, the callback method is never invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> and specifying a positive value for `dueTime`.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为负一 (-1) 毫秒，永远不会调用回调方法，计时器处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用来重新启用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>并指定为正值`dueTime`。

trans-unit.source: If `period` is zero (0) or negative one (-1) milliseconds, and `dueTime` is positive, the callback method is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> and specifying a value greater than zero for `period`.
trans-unit.target: 如果`period`是零 (0) 或负一 (-1) 毫秒，和`dueTime`为正、 回调方法会调用一次; 处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用重新启用它的计时器定期行为<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>并指定一个值大于对于该值为零`period`。

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method can be called from the <xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback> delegate.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法可以从调用<xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback>委托。

trans-unit.source: The following code example demonstrates how to start a `Timer` and, after a set number of invocations, change its period.
trans-unit.target: 下面的代码示例演示如何开始`Timer`以及在多次调用后更改其周期。

trans-unit.source: The <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> has already been disposed.
The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter, in milliseconds, is less than -1.
The <paramref name="dueTime" /> or <paramref name="period" /> parameter, in milliseconds, is greater than 4294967294.
The amount of time to delay before the invoking the callback method specified when the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> was constructed, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to prevent the timer from restarting.
Specify zero (0) to restart the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of the callback method specified when the <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> was constructed, in milliseconds.
Specify <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> to disable periodic signaling.
Changes the start time and the interval between method invocations for a timer, using 32-bit unsigned integers to measure time intervals.
<see langword="true" /> if the timer was successfully updated; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
The callback method is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the time interval specified by `period` elapses.
trans-unit.target: 一次后调用的回调方法`dueTime`过后，并且之后每次指定的时间间隔内`period`间隔。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is zero (0), the callback method is invoked immediately.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`为零 (0)，则会立即调用回调方法。

trans-unit.source: If `dueTime` is <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the callback method is never invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> and specifying a positive value for `dueTime`.
trans-unit.target: 如果`dueTime`是<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，永远不会调用回调方法，计时器处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用来重新启用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>并指定为正值`dueTime`。

trans-unit.source: If `period` is zero (0) or <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and `dueTime` is not <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the callback method is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> and specifying a positive value for `period`.
trans-unit.target: 如果`period`为零 (0) 或<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，和`dueTime`不<xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>，一次调用回调方法，计时器定期行为处于禁用状态，但可以通过调用来重新启用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>并指定为正值`period`.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method can be called from the <xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback> delegate.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法可以从调用<xref:System.Threading.TimerCallback>委托。

trans-unit.source: The <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> has already been disposed.
Releases all resources used by the current instance of <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" />.
Releases all resources used by the current instance of <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" />.
Calling `Dispose` allows the resources used by the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> to be reallocated for other purposes.
trans-unit.target: 调用`Dispose`允许使用的资源<xref:System.Threading.Timer>可以重新分配用于其他目的。

trans-unit.source: For more information about `Dispose`, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).
trans-unit.target: 有关详细信息`Dispose`，请参阅[清洗向上非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

trans-unit.source: Callbacks can occur after the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose> method overload has been called, because the timer queues callbacks for execution by thread pool threads.
trans-unit.target: 回调可能发生后<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose>已调用方法重载，因为计时器是按线程池线程来安排回调的执行。

trans-unit.source: You can use the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29> method overload to wait until all callbacks have completed.
trans-unit.target: 你可以使用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29>方法重载来等待，直到完成所有的回调。

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to free the resources held by a `Timer`.
trans-unit.target: 下面的代码示例说明如何释放由持有的资源`Timer`。

trans-unit.source: The <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> to be signaled when the <see langword="Timer" /> has been disposed of.
Releases all resources used by the current instance of <see cref="T:System.Threading.Timer" /> and signals when the timer has been disposed of.
<see langword="true" /> if the function succeeds; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
Calling `Dispose` allows the resources used by the <xref:System.Threading.Timer> to be reallocated for other purposes.
trans-unit.target: 调用`Dispose`允许使用的资源<xref:System.Threading.Timer>可以重新分配用于其他目的。

trans-unit.source: For more information about `Dispose`, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).
trans-unit.target: 有关详细信息`Dispose`，请参阅[清洗向上非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

trans-unit.source: When this method completes, it signals the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> specified by the `notifyObject` parameter.Use this overload of the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%2A> method if you want to be able to block until you are certain that the timer has been disposed.
trans-unit.target: 此方法完成时，它发出信号，<xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>指定的`notifyObject`参数。请使用此重载<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%2A>方法如果你希望能够进行阻止，直到您确信计时器已被释放。

trans-unit.source: The timer is not disposed until all currently queued callbacks have completed.
trans-unit.target: 完成所有当前排队的回调之前，计时器不会被释放。

trans-unit.source: If the callback uses the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method to set the `dueTime` parameter to zero, a race condition can occur when the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29> method overload is called: If the timer queues a new callback before the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29> method overload detects that there are no callbacks queued, <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29> continues to block; otherwise, the timer is disposed while the new callback is being queued, and an <xref:System.ObjectDisposedException> is thrown when the new callback calls the <xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: 如果回调使用<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法以设置`dueTime`参数为零，可能会发生争用问题时<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29>调用方法重载： 如果计时器队列之前的新回调<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29>方法重载检测到存在要排队发送没有回调，<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Dispose%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%29>继续阻止; 而新的回调正在排队，与否则，处理计时器<xref:System.ObjectDisposedException>新回调调用时，将引发<xref:System.Threading.Timer.Change%2A>方法。

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="notifyObject" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
